page.title: 12EDUCATION, DRAMA SCHOOL
page.content:
{REDROOFS} Littlewick Green. This building is 300 years old in parts. It has 12 rooms, a Theatre and Studios.
In{1924} it was bought by {Ivor {Novello} who lived in it until his death in 1950. He wrote the well known song{" We'll {gather lilacs "}while living there. He left it to the Actor's Benevolent Fund who ran it as a home for actors until{1954.}It was then sold and turned into flats.
In {1964} the present owners purchased it and turned it into a {Drama School.
The school still uses this property but is so popular for the education of budding actors and actresses that they also use buildings in Maidenhead.
